thread.title: Critics of Trump executive order rally in Munster
thread.title_full: Critics of Trump executive order rally in Munster

author: Carrie Napoleon
title: Critics of Trump executive order rally in Munster

organizations.name: northwest indiana federation of interfaith organizations

text:
Privacy Policy 
Hundreds of people including Jews, Muslims and Christians, descended on the Munster Town Hall grounds Monday for a rally against President Donald Trump 's executive order barring some Muslims from entering the United States. 
They came wearing Yamakas, burkas, hijabs -- and even hipster knit caps -- waving signs reading "No Ban - No Wall" and "Unity is Key" and chanting "The people, united, will never be divided." At one point the crowd burst into song with a stanza of "This Land is Your Land." 
Following the rally a large group moved to the northern parkway of Ridge Road, continuing their chants as passing motorists honked their horns. 
Speakers urged those attending to contact their elected officials and make their voices heard. 
"I am so heartened so many people left work, people left their homes to express solidarity with us Muslims," Dr. Muhammad Mazen Kudami, chairman of the Illiana Islamic Association in Highland, said. The Northwest Indiana Federation of Interfaith Organizations organized the rally with the Children of Abraham, a combination several mosques, churches and synagogues working together send medical supplies to those in need around the world. 
Omar Estwani, secretary of the board for the Northwest Islamic Center in Crown Point, said he is a first generation Syrian who was born and raised in America, but met his wife in Syria. He said when he asked her to marry him and come to the U.S., he promised her America is the land of the free and her rights will always be protected here. The events since Friday initially made him feel he broke that promise. His wife is now questioning if she will ever see her parents again.
